body_html:
Hi @eaplatanios,
Using some features only in training but not in inference is supported. create_estimator_spec has mode as arguments. Based on mode, head developer can choose which part of the features they want to use. Is that what you're asking?

about the history: Head API was first started when we were designing/prototyping the tf.contrib.learn API. This one is the last version which is fine tuned based on our experience.
body_text:
Hi @eaplatanios,
Using some features only in training but not in inference is supported. create_estimator_spec has mode as arguments. Based on mode, head developer can choose which part of the features they want to use. Is that what you're asking?
about the history: Head API was first started when we were designing/prototyping the tf.contrib.learn API. This one is the last version which is fine tuned based on our experience.
body:
Hi @eaplatanios,
Using some features only in training but not in inference is supported. `create_estimator_spec` has `mode` as arguments. Based on `mode`, head developer can choose which part of the features they want to use. Is that what you're asking?

about the history: Head API was first started when we were designing/prototyping the tf.contrib.learn API. This one is the last version which is fine tuned based on our experience.
